name: Mercure Bologna Centro

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed one night at this hotel. We chose it because of its location directly opposite the railway station where the Aerobus from the airport (4.5 euros each way) stops. It is also a ten minute walk, along the straight porticoed Via Independenza, to the city centre. This road is lined with shops so is an interesting walk. We had a room on the first floor overlooking the courtyard garden at the rear of the hotel. So it was very quiet. The room was also clean and well equipped - mini bar, trouser press, 23 channel TV etc. The hotel does not have a restaurant but there are plenty of restaurants and places to buy take away food around the hotel - and loads more in the city centre. The hotel breakfast (an American buffet) was fine with both hot food (scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages) and cold food including a very good selection of breads/pastries. It's not the greatest hotel I've stayed in. It is not the cheapest - we paid £85 sterling through an Expedia special offer. It's not the best located if your interest is really the city centre. But for us it did the job for a one night stopover. It was nowhere near as bad as some previous reviewers have said!
reviews.title: A convenient stopover

reviews.title: Avoid this hotel!
reviews.text: Stayed 1 night at the end of March. 2006. A very disappointing experience at this hotel and I have big doubt about the SofitelPrivilege Card program. Despite making the reservation online via the Accor website with all my Privilege Card details included and served by the Duty Manager onsite upon checked in (again with my Privilege Card presented and validated), I got NO special treatments nor gifts at all. In fact, a very unpleasant checked in with rude service provided by the Duty Manager. We had to carry our suitcases to our room. I raised my question about those benefits to the Duty Manager after I have checked in the room and she denied any knowledge about the benefits to the Privilege Card Holders and offered a voucher for 2 free soft drinks at the bar as a gesture of good will. Funny enough, all the gifts (water, a bottle of wine, slippers and bathrobes) suddenly appeared in our room when we came back in the evening! These special treatments should have provided UPON arrival, not after chasing!I will choose to stay at the StarHotel next time.
I wrote a complaint to their Head Office and this is the response I got back...
reviews.title: Great location & staff
Sofitel Bologna
reviews.text: "We were very sorry to hear of the problems you encountered and we apologize. We have contacted Mr. Virginio Jean Aouad , General Manager of Sofitel Bologna, and we do assure you that proper actions have been taken."

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the lobby has a moderni-ish feel, our room was very brown and definitely in need of redecoration. Nonetheless, the room was spotless, the bed comfortable and the a/c worked well. On the tv, we had about 7 Italian channels plus one each of English, German, Spanish, etc. The room and bathroom were standard sized for a double. Breakfast was included ----an assortment of cold cuts, breads, cereals, fruits, eggs and bacon, along with a fantastic self-serve coffee machine which I wish I could have back home.
reviews.title: fab hotel

reviews.text: As for location, the hotel is right across the street from the Bologna train station and about a 15 minute walk to Piazza Maggiore along some very pretty porticoed sidewalks. Bologna is more of a busy, working city, although the center is pretty and there's certainly enough to keep you going for a day. The city, however, makes a great base from which to visit smaller cities in the Emilia-Romagna (Ferrera, Modena, Ravenna, etc.) by train so if you're inclined to do that, the location is pretty ideal.
reviews.title: Not that bad

reviews.text: We compared prices at the UNA, Starhotels and the Mercure, all of which are right next to each other on the same street. We paid $145 and thought it was good value for what we got as the Mercure is really more of a 3.5 star hotel. Overall, a decent pick for Bologna.
reviews.title: Find another place to stay

description: The Hotel Mercure Bologna Centro is just across from the main railway station, close to the historic city centre, and a 10 minute drive from the exhibition centre and the airport. The hotel offers 244 rooms equipped with all 4 star comforts and services.There are 3 non smoking floors. The 5000 sqm hotel garden is open to guests. Pay parking with direct access to the hotel is available. PETS ARE NOT ALLOWED IN THE HOTEL.
